interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Anti-Aging Hydrating Serum with Natural Mango Micro-beads, Vitamins E and C, Natural and Organic Plant Extracts, Paraben-Free, 30 ml, Made in France, Phytema
Review Date: 2018/11/25
Store: PHYTEMA
Product Description: ['Anti-Aging Hydrating Serum with Natural Mango Micro-beads, Vitamins E and C, Natural and Organic Plant Extracts, Paraben-Free, 30 ml, Made in France, Phytema']
Average Rating: 3.5
Product Details: {'Brand': 'PHYTEMA', 'Material Feature': 'Organic, Natural', 'Item Volume': '30 Milliliters', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Package Dimensions': '4.8 x 1.4 x 1.4 inches; 4.23 Ounces', 'Manufacturer': 'PHYTEMA'}
Review Text: I've had some splotchy acne here and there. Not like teenage acne but I get little flesh colored bumps in certain areas/patches on my face and neck. I started thinking maybe I had too much bacteria on my face even though I wash it everyday but decided to use dial soap on it. That wasn't helping at all. I heard that serums are really good on your face and if your face isn't well moisturized it will produce more sebum which in turns can cause more acne. This stuff has been great! It's not completely gone but it's a lot better. I didn't take any pictures cause since they were flesh colored you could hardly see them especially in a photo. I feel like my skin glows a little better since I've been using this too. I was afraid "vit C" would break me out cause of the acids but Apparently it's the opposite. Those acids are good for your skin. I would certainly recommend this!
Review Title: Helped my acne
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Optic Shop Pro-Moisture Chamber With Elastic Head Band - Size Small
Optic Shop
['Small PRO-MOISTURE CHAMBER WITH ELASTIC HEAD BAND - White Foam. One Elastic Chamber. Ideal for dry-eye conditions. Clear vinyl shield with soft sponge edging that gently hugs facial contours. Product dimensions: 40mm vertical, 60mm Horizontal. Combat miserable dry eye conditions with the Pro-Moisture Chamber with Elastic Head Band from Optic Shop. Clear vinyl shielding offers ideal eye protection. Inner lining of soft sponge material hugs the contours of the face and provides hours of comfortable wear. Comes with comfortable elastic head band, and fits both the left and right eyes. Size Small and package quantity of 1.']
{'Color': 'White', 'Age Range (Description)': 'Adult', 'Material': 'Plastic', 'Fabric Type': 'Foam', 'Number of Items': '1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Product Dimensions': '0.2 x 2.36 x 1.57 inches; 0.32 Ounces', 'Item model number': '144SB', 'Date First Available': 'May 20, 2015', 'Manufacturer': 'Optic Shop'}
I bought this when I had a bout of bells palsy and I wish I wouldn't have wasted the money. I didn't really use it even though it was a great idea it was just uncomfortable and kept fogging up. The foam around it is rough and hurt the soft skin around my eye. The strap I found to be fine once I tied it off to fit me. I still have it and if I ever have another bout of BP I might glue or somehow put some soft fabric around it. Won't fix the fogging up but it might make it feel a little more comfortable. Don't have anything to lose. I wouldn't wear it like it is.
Great idea....
Butecare Eyelash Growth Enhancer & Brow Serum for Long - Amazon Vine
{'Package Dimensions': '4.5 x 0.9 x 0.9 inches; 0.81 Ounces'}
Didn't work at all for me. Plus I was really worried about what would happen if it got into my eyes. They made it clear to NOT get it on your eyelids because it doesn't need to go into your eyes. That worries me because I know no matter how careful I am there's probably going to some that will drip down into my eye. Anything that's going on or around my eyes shouldn't be toxic. And maybe they only say that as a precaution and it wouldn't hurt your eye but I don't like to take chances with my eyes.
No luck for me

I've had some splotchy acne here and there. Not like teenage acne but I get little flesh colored bumps in certain areas/patches on my face and neck. I started thinking maybe I had too much bacteria on my face even though I wash it everyday but decided to use dial soap on it. That wasn't helping at all. I heard that serums are really good on your face and if your face isn't well moisturized it will produce more sebum which in turns can cause more acne. This stuff has been great! It's not completely gone but it's a lot better. I didn't take any pictures cause since they were flesh colored you could hardly see them especially in a photo. I feel like my skin glows a little better since I've been using this too. I was afraid "vit C" would break me out cause of the acids but Apparently it's the opposite. Those acids are good for your skin. I would certainly recommend this!

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Health Focus:** The user shows a keen interest in health products, particularly those that address specific skin concerns, including acne. They prioritize safety and effectiveness in all purchases, especially for products applied to sensitive areas like the face.
  
- **Comfort Preference:** Emphasizes comfort in product materials and fit, remaining cautious about potential irritants or adverse reactions, particularly with facial products.

- **Critical Evaluation:** The user adopts a pragmatic approach towards critiquing product effectiveness based on personal experiences, often demonstrating skepticism, especially regarding product safety and their impact on skin health.

- **Functional Utility Over Aesthetics:** Values functionality and therapeutic benefits, remaining open to comfort-enhancing modifications while ensuring that the products do not compromise safety.

- **Past Negative Experience:** Previous adverse experiences with health-related products add to their overall caution, indicating a deliberate and thorough evaluation process for new products.

- **Positive Engagement with New Products:** The recent positive experience with a skincare serum highlights an openness to trying products that may improve conditions like acne while maintaining a careful balance between effectiveness and ingredient safety.

Overall, the user prioritizes health, safety, and comfort in product selection, displaying a critical and adaptive approach to their needs, particularly around skincare and eye-related products.
